items.title: The Old Man River
items.description: Lethbridge has a large coulee going through the middle of it. The coulee is used to divide Lethbridge into the North/South sides and the West side. The Old Man river follows the coulee and makes a perfect rever bottom to hike and explore.

items.title: The Corn Maze
items.description: A new Corn Maze design is created each summer. It provides an easy and fun experience.

items.title: Waterton National Park
items.description: Waterton is a town and a national park close to the mountains and about a 1.5 hour drive from Lethbridge. Some activities to do at Woterton include hiking and camping.

items.title: The Birds Of Prey Center
items.description: The Birds of Prey Center is in Coaldale, which is only a 15 minute drive from Lethbridge. They rescue birds, help them recover, then usually release them.

items.title: Frank Slide
items.description: It is near the town of Frank. In 1903, the original town of Frank was burried by one of the deadliest rock slides in history.

items.title: Lethbridge Temple
items.description: It was announced in the April 2023 General Conference and is currently under construction.

items.title: Cornfest
items.description: The town of Taber, which is about a 30 minute drive from Lethbridge is famous for it's corn and has a yearly celebration called 'Cornfest'

items.title: Royal Tyrell Museum
items.description: The Royal Tyrell Museum in Drumheller has a large collection of dinosaur fossils, and information about scientific discovers related to dinosaurs. It is about a 2.5 hour drive from Lethbridge.
